page.title: 20HOME LIFE IN CALLINGTON AREA
page.content: The area east of Callington is principally a{dormitory area}for people working in Plymouth; professional, Service or Dockyard as main amployment. New estates and Naval influence bring a high percentage of in-coming families to the area, with the older farming community as the stable base of extended family life. Apart from the council estate there is little {unemployment,}but low wages do mean that many wives also have to work. Almost all homes have a television, fridge and washing machine, many have a freezer, tumble-drier, stereo and video equipment. A car is essential; some families have a{second vehicle for a working member of the family - a car, motor-cycle or moped - while the wife uses the family car for shopping or school.
